doc.abstracts: In July 1986, Bernadette Schmitt was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert Oliver. During her tenure at the Bank from 1963 to 1969, Mrs. Schmitt served as a secretary in the office of the president under George Woods. Her transcript concerns the office of the president, contributions to Mellon securities and First Boston, the president visiting India, the relationship between George Woods and former president Eugene Black, and work at the World Bank after the president’s resignation in 1968.
